Raising sheep is very good because many times we can sell them when we don't have money, which gets us through tough times. The only problem Doña Andrea has had in the past ten years has been when her sheep become sick and die. Sheep deaths represent losses of both income and investments to Doña Andrea. She therefore tries to take excellent care of them and has a veterinarian examine them every two to three months. Doña Andrea works long hours caring for her sheep so she can provide her children an education. Her dream is for one of the children to have a professional career. The other members of the "Colonia Zapata" group are very happy and grateful to KIVA and Vision Fund because they'll be able to invest in their businesses. Doña Leonarda, Aurelia, and Maxima will purchase sheep, Martha will purchase feed for her animals, and Ofelia will buy feed for the calves she keeps at her home.

loans.use: to purchase sheep and feed.

loans.name: Santa Cruz De Cocachacra Group

texts.es: “SANTA CRUZ DE COCACHACRA” es un grupo puntual en sus cuotas grupales. Está  conformada por 09 socios  quienes día a día trabajan para mejorar su economía familiar. Violeta tiene 51 años es casada con 1 hijo educando en la universidad. Hace varios implementó una bodega en su vivienda. En la actualidad  lo convirtió en restaurante  en donde ofrece golosinas, gaseosas. Años atrás trabajaba como ayudante de cocina. Es de esta manera que decidió emprender su negocio propio en el que le va bien. El préstamo lo invertirá en la compra de gaseosas y sillas y mesas para su negocio. Su mayor deseo es lograr que su hija termine su carrera profesional. El grupo agradece a los inversionistas KIVA por el préstamo brindado. Violeta es la primera persona sentada del lado derecho.
texts.en:
Santa Cruz De Cocachacra is a group that is punctual with its group payments.  It is comprised of nine members who work day to day in order to improve their families’ finances.

Violeta, age 51, is married and has one child, who attends the university.  Several years ago she set up a store in her house.  She has now converted it into a restaurant, where she offers snacks and soft drinks.

Years ago she worked as a kitchen helper.  That is how she decided to undertake her own business, which is going well for her.

She will use the loan to buy soft drinks, chairs, and tables for her business.  Her biggest wish is for her daughter to complete her professional studies.  

The group is grateful to the Kiva lenders for the proffered loan.  Violeta is the first person seated on the right.

loans.use: to buy soft drinks, tables, and chairs.

loans.name: Choi Aan Lom Group

texts.en:
“Choi-Aan” group is an eight-member group of the Thadou-Kuki tribe, and their representative is Ngahneikim. She is pictured with her hand raised in the photograph. They live in the hilly regions of Manipur, in the northeastern parts of India. 

Ngahneikim is married and blessed with four daughters and two sons. The eldest is 21 and the youngest of the siblings is 2 years of age. Her husband is a peon in the post office with a meager monthly salary, which is not enough to support the family. Because of this, the two eldest siblings of the family did not attend school; instead, they work in the fields growing vegetables to support the family. However, three other siblings are enrolled in the government school in the village. 

Ngahneikim faced all kinds of problems in taking care of the family expenditures and paying the monthly school fees and other expenses of her school-going children. So, since 2009, she started selling vegetables in the nearby town, and with the help of her two children, plants and grows all kinds of vegetables for consumption and also for sale. She said that her daily income somehow helps with the family’s daily expenses. At the same time, with the help of her two elder children, she also raises piglets for sale.

Ngahneikim said that with the loan from Kiva, she will buy all kinds of seasonal seeds and saplings to cultivate them in her vegetable field. Most of the vegetables that she sells are the produce from her vegetable field. She sells them in the nearby town and the village.
 
The other group members are also engaged in income-generating activities like raising piglets, chicks, cows, and buffaloes; they also sell vegetables in the neighbouring villages.

loans.use: to purchase seasonal seeds and saplings for cultivation.

loans.name: 5 De Mayo Group

texts.es:
Bertha es una señora de 65 años, solo estudio la primaria y es soltera. Ella es una de los integrantes de un grupo llamado 5 de mayo. Este grupo se encuentra ubicado en una ciudad de Veracruz que se caracteriza por sus fuertes calores. Doña Bertha platica que se ha dedicado al comercio de abarrotes por 42 años, su negocio es una de las tiendas más antiguas de la ciudad, dicha tienda se encentra ubicada en su hogar en un pequeño local el cual construyo poco a poco.
Doña Bertha está muy contenta con su negocio ya que gracias a el ha tenido un empleo durante todos estos años y la ha ayudado a salir adelante y tener una mejor calidad de vida.
Lo que más le ha gustado de su negocio es el tratar a diario a la gente y ha visto crecer a varias generaciones que acuden desde pequeños a su negocio.
Ella ha solicitado este crédito a VisionFund para resurtir su negocio comprando frijol, aceite, arroz, sopa, productos enlatados, frituras, papel de baño, dulces, refrescos, jugos, galletas y saborizantes.
Ella quiere seguir trabajando en su negocio e irlo surtiendo cada día más con  muchos productos más.
Ella dijo: “Gracias por el apoyo que me ha dado VisionFund con sus créditos que nos hacen sentir participantes de estos beneficios aunque ya somos grandes en edad”.
Los demás integrantes del grupo son:
María de Lourdes- Venta de Ropa
Yessenia-Venta de Abarrotes
Sonia-Sastreria
Teresa-Venta de Zapatos
Ernestina-Venta de comida
Hilda-Venta de zapatos
Maricela-Venta de comida
Clara venta de Bisuteria
Veronica-venta de Ropa
Daisy Maricela-Venta de Bisuteria
texts.en:
Bertha’s a 65-year-old woman who only attended primary school; she’s single.  She’s one of the members of the group called “5 de Mayo”.  This group is located in city in Veracruz, a place noted for the intense heat.  Bertha relates that she’s been selling groceries for 42 years; her store is one of the city's oldest and it’s located in a small locale she built little by little.

Bertha is very happy with her business because thanks to it she’s been employed all these years and it’s helped her to get ahead and to have better quality of life.  What she’s liked best about her work is to deal with people daily; she’s watched several generations grow who have been coming to her store since they were little.

She’s asked VisiónFund for this loan to stock her store; she will buy beans, oil, rice, soup, canned goods, snacks, and toilet paper, candy, soft-drinks, juices, cookies and flavoring agents.  She wants to continue working in her business and continue stocking it with more products every day.  She said: “Thanks for the support VisiónFund has given me through their loans through which we feel like we still belong even though we are of advanced age.”

The other group members are:
María de Lourdes- Clothing Sales
Yessenia- Grocery Sales
Sonia- Tailor Shop
Teresa- Shoe Sales
Ernestina- Food Sales
Hilda- Shoe Sales Food Sales
Marisela - Food Sales
Clara - Costume Jewelry Sales
Veronica- Clothing Sales
Daisy Maricela- Costume Jewelry Sales

loans.use: to buy stock merchandise for her store.

loans.name: Darryl

texts.en:
P. Commercial Cleaning is a family-owned, start-up business that began in April 2013 in Beaumont, Texas.  Led by Darryl, he and his family each play a role as they clean multiple properties daily and make sure everything sparkles before they leave.   

While at the Small Business Administration in Houston, Darryl discovered Accion Texas Inc. He took the SBA’s advice, applied for a loan, and was pleased with Accion’s smooth process.  His loan allowed him to purchase mops, buckets, brooms, towels and other cleaning supplies to begin working.  The loan also allowed for extra cash flow to cover start-up costs.

Currently, only he and his family work for the business but Darryl plans to expand and hire more employees once the business progresses.  Darryl primarily uses word of mouth to advertise but is open to venture into social media.  He is eager to gain more business and keep shining.  He also looks forward to working with Accion again.

He enjoys each day the family is able to learn and work together.  The values and life lessons of hard-work will be embedded in his children forever.  Darryl says, “Without the loan, the business would have not been able to start.”

loans.use: to purchase mops, buckets, brooms, towels and other cleaning supplies, and cover start-up costs

loans.name: Las Artesanas Del Fresno Group

texts.es: El grupo “Las Artesanas del Fresno” está compuesto por seis integrantes todas son muy buenas vecinas se conocen muy bien viven en una comunidad mazahua que se caracteriza porque la mayoría de las personas se dedican a la elaboración de sus bordados, además en la comunidad existen arboles muy frondosos, los habitantes de la comunidad son muy arraigados a sus costumbres y tradiciones un elemento fundamental para las personas de esta comunidad es su lengua mazahua. Decidieron ponerle ese nombre a su grupo porque todas se dedican a la elaboración de bordados. Doña Alejandra es una nueva integrante del grupo platica que tiene 51 años de edad está casada desde hace 28 años con el señor Marcos juntos formaron una familia con cuatro hijos de los cuales ya ninguno depende de dicha pareja. Doña Alejandra se dedica a la elaboración de bordados desde hace cuarenta años, cuanta que aprendió a bordar porque desde muy chica su mama también se dedicaba a la elaboración de estas artesanías. Doña Alejandra argumento “Saber bordar es toda una tradición, aquí quien no elabora estos tipos de bordados es como si no vivieran en la comunidad porque es parte de nuestras costumbres”. La señora Alejandra tiene un local en su casa donde pone a venta artesanías para ella no hay ningún problema para realizarlos, esta vez está solicitando el crédito para comprar materia prima como agujas, estambres, tela de lana, etc. “Para mí el crédito será de gran ayuda porque así podre adquirir más fácilmente mis materiales” El reto de Doña Alejandra es la falta de mercado para poder ofrecer sus artesanías, en su comunidad y sus alrededores es muy difícil obtener buenas ganancias. “Me gustaría que nos ayudaran a buscar un buen mercado o algún medio para ofrecer nuestros bordados”. La meta de Doña Alejandra y las integrantes del grupo es mejorar la calidad de vida de su familia se esfuerzan mucho para obtener las mejores ganancias para solventar los gastos de su hogar como la educación de sus hijos, para comprarle ropa, zapatos y mas alimentos. Así como Doña Angélica y las integrantes del grupo están muy agradecidas por el crédito porque podrán invertir sus actividades Doña Ángeles invertirá en la venta de sus cosméticos, Doña Angelina, Zenaida, Martina y Guadalupe en material para sus bordados.
texts.en: The “Las Artesanas del Fresno” group consists of six members who are all close neighbors and friends in a Mazahua community with many lush trees where many people make embroidered handicrafts. Members of this community have remained loyal to their customs and traditions, one of the most important being the Mazahua language. The group members decided on their name because they all make embroidered handicrafts. Doña Alejandra, a new member of the group, is 51 and has for 28 years been married to Marcos. They have four children who are all independent. Doña Alejandra has made handicrafts for forty years, having learned embroidery very young because her mother was also an embroiderer. Doña Alejandra explained, "Knowing how to embroider is a tradition. If someone here doesn't know how to embroider, it's as if that person didn't live in the community because this  skill is a part of our customs." Doña Alejandra sells handicrafts from her home and has no difficulty making them. She is seeking this loan to purchase materials such as needles, yarn, wool thread, etc. "The loan will help me greatly because it will allow me to purchase materials more easily." Doña Alejandra's challenge is the lack of a market where she can sell her handicrafts. It's difficult to earn a good income in her community and surrounding towns. "I'd like to find a way to help us identify a good market or some other way to offer our crafts," she explained. Doña Alejandra and the other group members share the goal of improving their families' quality of life. They each strive diligently to earn a better income so they can meet their household expenses: children's education, clothing, shoes, and more food. Doña Angélica and the other group members are all very grateful for the loan because it will allow them to invest in their business. Doña Ángeles will purchase cosmetics, while Doña Angelina, Zenaida, Martina, and Guadalupe pull purchase materials to make their handicrafts.

loans.use: to buy materials such as fabric, different colors of thread, and special needles to make handicrafts.

loans.name: Juan Isaac

texts.es:
Juan, 33 años de edad, habita en la comarca El Escobillo en las afueras de Boaco, casado, padre de 3 hijos, de oficio agricultor, siembra maíz, frijol y trigo, lleva 18 años dedicándose a esta actividad. El inicio trabajando desde muy joven en las huertas de su papa pero al casarse se independizo y comenzó a trabajar junto con su esposa en sus propias tierras también se dedica a la crianza de ganado. Actualmente siembra maíz, frijol y trigo. Hoy está solicitando el crédito para comprar abonos, fertilizantes y pagar mano de obra para sembrar  frijoles. 
El espera sacar una producción de calidad y mejorar las cercas que protegen las huertas. Su próxima  meta  es lograr  sacar una producción de frijoles con buenos rendimientos y pagar  su crédito y con la ganancia obtenida le gustaría invertir en mejorar el techo de su vivienda.
texts.en:
Juan, 33, lives in the El Escobillo district in the outskirts of Boaco.  He is married, and is the father of 3 children.  He is a farmer who cultivates corn, beans and wheat.  He has 18 years of experience in farming.  

Juan started working on his father's lands when he was very young, but when he got married he became independent and started to work with his wife on land that they own.  He also raises livestock.

At this time, he is cultivating corn, beans and wheat.  He is requesting a loan to buy organic and chemical fertilizers, and to pay for labor to plant beans.  He hopes to get a good quality harvest, and to improve the fencing that protects his land.  His next goal is to get a good harvest of beans so that he can make a good return and pay off his loan, and with the profits he obtains he would like to invest in improving the roof of his house.

loans.use: to buy organic and chemical fertilizers, and to pay for labor to plant beans

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy clothes to sell.

loans.name: Diaa

texts.en:
Diaa is 28 years old and is from Ramallah. He is married and has one child.

Diaa has owned a grocery store since 2003, and he has one employee. He asked Ryada for this loan in order to buy a refrigerator and install shelves in the grocery store.

He hopes that this loan will help him increase the goods displayed, and thus improve his income.

loans.use: to buy a refrigerator and install shelves in the grocery store.

loans.name: Ayham

texts.en:
Ayham is 27 years old and from a refugee camp in Nablus. He is married and has seven children. He is a doctor and owns a clinic.

Ayham asked Ryada for this youth loan in order to develop the reception area and buy some medical equipment. He hopes that this loan will help him develop his clinic and make it more suitable for his patients.

loans.use: to develop the reception area and buy some medical equipment.

loans.name: Ali

texts.en:
Ali is 22 years-old and from Jenin.

Since 2010, he has owned a clothing shop for men and ladies and he has two employees.

He asked Kiva partner Ryada for this youth loan in order to open a space for selling kids clothes and to buy some kids clothes.

He hopes that this loan will help him increase his sales and thus improve his income.

loans.use: to open a space for selling kids clothes and to buy some kids clothes.

loans.name: Gohar

texts.en:
Gohar is acquainted with Kiva lenders since she has already previously taken a loan and she knows that she can fully trust and expect support from Kiva. 

She has a farm, which was enriched through the help of her first loan with twenty-five sheep, which were added to the fifteen sheep that she used to have before. Like last year, Gohar’s occupation is still sheep breeding and her farm is very well known around the village Ghghamvan in the Sevan area where she lives.  Sheep breeding gives her an opportunity to sell some meat and cheese that she makes herself, which brings not big but nevertheless some income to her family.

Gohar is married and she has two sons.  The eldest is a student of paid division and the second one is still school-aged. It is obvious that the financial needs in this family are a lot and Gohar tries to solve them somehow.

Gohar is asking for a loan of 1.000.000 Armenian drams in order to buy twenty sheep and to repair the barn by making it bigger and warmer for the coming winter cold months.

loans.use: to buy twenty sheep and to do repair work of the animal barn.

loans.name: Mary Jeaneth

texts.es:
Mary es una mujer joven de 28 años, aprobó sus estudios hasta la instrucción primaria, se casó siendo muy joven con Byron que actualmente tiene 29 años y es copropietario del negocio familiar y además trabaja en transportes que viajan fuera de la ciudad hasta la Región Costa del Ecuador. Tienen 2 hijos; Kevin que tiene 10 años de edad y Britany que cuenta con 2 añitos, Kevin estudia en la escuela pública de la ciudad y Britany aún está al cuidado de su madre en casa. Esta familia esforzada vive en Latacunga capital de la provincia de Cotopaxi, una de las provincias que forma parte de la Región Sierra del Ecuador y que los últimos años se ha desarrollado notablemente de tal forma que es considerada una de las más importantes de la región gracias a la industria florícola, minera, metalúrgica, agroindustria, agrícola y ganadera. Además existen establecimientos de negocios que generan interesantes ingresos lo que le convierte en una ciudad comercial y con varias oportunidades para salir adelante. 
Mary se dedica a la elaboración de bloques de cemento desde hace 9 años aunque ya conocía sobre esta actividad de toda su vida, pues en su familia también se dedicaban a lo mismo. Ella junto a su esposo dedican al menos 9 horas cada día a la preparación de materiales, mezcla, forma y terminado de los bloques. En los últimos días la demanda ha incrementado y la falta de material no le permite cumplir con todos sus clientes, mucho más cuando en época de lluvia los bloques tardan más tiempo con el proceso de secado. Es por esto que Mary ha solicitado un préstamo que le permita comprar quintales de cemento y arena al por mayor para conseguir a mejor precio y así incrementar la producción lo que por ende, le generará mayores utilidades para un día poder hacer realidad su sueño de comprar un camión para poder hacer entregas a domicilio. Mary agradece la apertura y confianza que Fundación Alternativa ha tenido con ella, ya que muchas veces se le dificultó la obtención de un crédito en otras entidades financieras. Mary envía mucha gratitud a quienes alrededor del mundo y a través de Kiva, están aportando para que la calidad de vida de su familia mejore.
texts.en:
Mary is a 28 year old young woman.  She went to school through primary school.  She got married when she was very young to Byron who is now 29 years old and the co-owner of the family business.  He also works in transportation, traveling outside the city to the coastal region of Ecuador.  They have two children, Kevin, who is 10 years old, and Britany, who is 2. Kevin studies at the public school in the city and Britany stays at home with her mother.  

The family lives in Latacunga, the capital of the Cotopaxi province, which is one of the provinces that forms part of the Sierra region of Ecuador.  In the last few years it has developed and is considered one of the most important in the region thanks to the flower, mineral, metallurgy, agro-industry, farming, and livestock industries.  In addition, there are businesses that generate interesting income that make it a commercial city with various opportunities to get ahead.

Mary has worked for nine years making cement blocks.  She has known this activity all her life since all of her family work doing the same thing.  Together with her husband, she works at least nine hours a day preparing the materials, mixing, forming, and finishing the blocks.  Recently, demand has increased and a lack of materials prevents her from serving all of her customers.  In addition, in the rainy season, the blocks take more time to dry.  This has led Mary to request a loan to purchase 46 kilogram sacks of cement and sand at wholesale so that she gets a better price.  This will allow her to increase production so that she will generate higher profits.  One day she hopes to realize her dream of purchasing a truck to be able to make deliveries to her customers' homes.  Mary appreciates the openness and trust that Fundacion Alternativa has in her since many times it has been difficult to obtain a loan from other financial entities.  Mary sends much gratitude to everyone around the world that is making her family's quality of life improve through Kiva.

loans.use: to purchase materials and tools to increase her production.

loans.name: Astone

texts.en:
Astone is requesting a loan to complete paying for his car that he had acquired on a debt so that he could lobby for various contracts. 

He is an engineer who has retired from active service in government and now does contracts with various institutions.  He also earns extra money from his monthly pension.  Inadequate capital and corruption affect his operations while his dream is to own a well established company.

loans.use: .to complete paying for his car.

loans.name: Gerald

texts.en:
Gerald is a 30 year-old hardworking man with three children who lives in Fort Portal ,Uganda. 

His main source of income is working as a driver and he also practices farming in order to boost his income.  He faces a hardship of inadequate capital.  However, he has a vision of increasing his daily income through diversifying his business.  Gerald is requesting a loan in order to buy agricultural inputs such as seeds for planting.

loans.use: to buy agricultural inputs such as seeds for planting.

loans.name: Carlos Luis

texts.es: Carlos Luis es un joven dedicado a su familia y a su trabajo, labora vendiendo perfumes a domicilio desde hace seis meses, ya tiene su zona de clientes y quiere extenderse a otras comunidades ya que es necesario incremnetar sus ingresos, él necesita un crédito por seiscientos sesenta mil colones (¢660.000), con este dinero comprará perfumes y aguas refrescantes para ofrecer a su clientela.
texts.en: Carlos Luis is a young man who is dedicated to his family and to his work. For the last six months he has worked selling perfumes, and he has built his range of customers. He wishes to expand to other communities, since that is what it will take to increase his income. He needs a loan of ¢660.000, which he will use to purchase perfumes and body sprays for his customers.

loans.use: purchase perfumes for in-home sales.

loans.name: Mayis

texts.en:
Mayis is a young farmer and he is also engaged in agriculture. He owns a rich farm where he keeps three cows, two calves, two heifers, three piglets, fifteen chickens, four sheep and four beehives. 

Mayis and his family lives in Geghamavan village in the Gegharkunik area. He lives with his wife, his retired mother and four children. His wife is unemployed and she helps Mayis at their farm a great deal. Mayis works at the same time at the gas fueling station as a loader.
 
Mayis is asking for a loan of 1.000.000 Armenian drams in order to buy two cows and ten sheep in order to develop his farming and enlarge the family income. He will be very happy to be supported by Kiva lenders and Nor Horizon.

loans.use: to buy two cows and ten sheep.

loans.name: Hayk

texts.en:
Hayk and his family own a big and beautiful farm which includes two cows, three bulls, two calves, two pigs and fourteen piglets, eight sheep, eight lambs and three chickens. Hayk has earned all these during many years and by working tirelessly. Hayk is 58 years-old and lives in the village Zovaber in the Gegharkunik area. He has a big and lovely family which includes his wife, retired mother, sons, daughter-in–law and two grandsons.
 	
Hayk and his sons, despite of their salaries, the main income they have comes from farming and agriculture. So they have decided to ask for a loan of 1000.000 Armenian drams in order to buy three cows, twenty chickens and a lot of animal fodder. They will be very happy if, like many other people, they will also be supported by Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to buy three cows, twenty chickens and a lot of animal fodder.

loans.name: Jaime Oswaldo

texts.es:
Jaime es un hombre de 32 años, creció en un hogar de escasos recursos económicos, siempre le apoyaron, pero solo pudieron pagarle la escuela primaria, con cuyos conocimientos salió adelante y se defiende en su área. Está casado con Rosa de 30 años que trabaja realizando los quehaceres domésticos de su hogar, tienen 2 hijos de 13 y 11 años que se encuentran estudiando en un colegio público, y a quienes esperan darles la oportunidad de estudiar que ellos no tuvieron. Jaime con su familia viven en Latacunga capital de la provincia de Cotopaxi, una de las provincias que forma parte de la Región Sierra del Ecuador y que los últimos años se ha desarrollado notablemente de tal forma que es considerada una de las más importantes de la región gracias a la industria florícola, minera, metalúrgica, agroindustria, agrícola y ganadera. Además existen establecimientos de negocios que generan interesantes ingresos lo que le convierte en una ciudad comercial y con varias oportunidades para salir adelante. Aunque hay un alto índice de pobreza el espíritu emprendedor de sus habitantes ha hecho que la  ciudad sobresalga. En el sector rural y urbano se puede encontrar familias destacando sus talentos para emprender con alguna idea que les pueda generar rentabilidad para conseguir el sustento diario. 
Jaime desde hace 6 años emprendió con su carpintería que juntamente con su esposa la atienden y a la que dedica entre 6 y 8 horas diarias, con el paso del tiempo ha logrado conseguir clientes que siempre le buscan por entregar un producto terminado de calidad, sin embargo cuando empezó su negocio fue difícil  que confiaran en él por ser muy joven. Jaime sueña con tener un día su propia fábrica de muebles, es por esto que cada día se esfuerza más para mejorar su trabajo y así conseguir más clientes y también más experiencia pero uno de los obstáculos que ha atravesado es la dificultad para conseguir un crédito que le permita adquirir la madera necesaria y las herramientas para trabajar al por mayor, es por eso que ahora solicita un préstamo el cual lo utilizará en la compra de madera y materiales de carpintería que le permitan producir más y mejores productos con mayor eficacia y así lograr reconocimiento por su trabajo. Jaime agradece a Fundación Alternativa por abrirle las puertas con confianza y además capacitación para poder dar este de crecimiento en su negocio y además motiva a quienes a través de Kiva están aportando para que sus sueños se cumplan y así él pueda brindar a su familia un mejor estilo de vida.
texts.en:
Jaime is 32 years old and grew up in a home with few financial resources.  They always supported him but he was only able to pay for primary school.  With that knowledge, he was able to get ahead and succeed in his field.  He is married to Rosa, who is 30 years old, and takes cares of their home.  They have two children who are 13 and 11 years old who are studying at the public high school.  They hope to give them the opportunity to study that they did not have.  

Jaime and his family live in Latacunga, the capital of the Cotopaxi province, which is one of the provinces that form part of the Sierra region in Ecuador.   In the last few years it has developed and is considered one of the most important in the region thanks to the flower, mineral, metallurgy, agro-industry, farming, and livestock industries. In addition, there are businesses that generate interesting income that make it a commercial city with various opportunities to get ahead.  Although there is a high level of poverty, the entrepreneurial spirit of the inhabitants have made it a city that stands out.  In the rural and urban areas, it is possible to find families using their talents to undertake an idea that can generate profits to support their daily expenses.  

Jaime has worked for six years as a carpenter.  Together with his wife, they attend the business and work between six and eight hours a day.  With the passage of time, he has succeeded in finding customers who always look for a well-finished product.  When he started his business, it was difficult to trust him since he was very young.  Jaime dreams of having his own furniture factory.  Every day he makes an effort to improve his work so that he can gain more customers and more experience.  One of the obstacles he has overcome is the difficulty in obtaining a loan that will allow him to acquire the necessary wood and working tools at wholesale.  This is why he has requested a loan to purchase wood and carpentry materials that will allow him to produce more and better products with more efficiency so that he can become well-known for his work.

Jaime is grateful to Fundacion Alternativa for opening their doors with trust and training so that he can grow his business.  He is encouraged by the people who are supporting him through Kiva so that he can achieve his dreams and provide his family with a better way of life.

loans.use: to purchase wood and carpentry materials.

loans.name: Gloria Marlen

texts.es:
Doña Gloria tiene 43 años de edad, madre de 5 hijos los cuales ayudan en compañía de su pareja en las diferentes actividades que se realizan en el campo. En familia se dedican a la siembra de maíz, frijol y café ya que es una tradición por ambas partes de la familia tanto por la parte de su pareja como por la parte de ella. Fueron sus padres los que le enseñaron a trabajar la tierra y a la elaboración y siembra de viveros de café los cuales también son vendidos a los diferentes clientes los cuales son los propietarios de las fincas que están a los alrededores de su casa de habitación y otros que llegan a la zona en busca de un producto seguro y de calidad.

Doña Gloria Solicita a COMIXMUL un apoyo financiero para comprar fertilizantes y abono para fortalecer su vivero ya que es necesario para que se mantenga sano y fuerte al momento de trasplantarlo.

Sus sueños en el futuro son los de poder construir su propia casa y cultivar su propio producto en un terreno propio para poder generar mayores ingresos y seguir apoyando a sus hijos con sus estudios para que ellos se puedan preparar y salir adelante.
texts.en:
Gloria is a 43-year-old mother of five children. Her children, along with her partner, all help with the various activities around their farm. As a family, they grow rice, beans, and coffee, which is a tradition handed down from both her and her partner's sides of the family. It was her parents who taught her to work the land and build a nursery for coffee plants. These she sells to various customers, both to the owners of local plantations, as well as farmers coming from further away in search of a secure, high-quality product.

Gloria came to COMIXMUL looking for financial support to purchase fertilizer and manure to strengthen her nursery since it is so important that the plants stay healthy and strong while being transplanted.

In the future, she dreams of building her own house, and raising her own crops on her own land. This would help her earn greater income and continue to support her children with their schooling, so that they can be ready to get ahead.

loans.use: purchase fertilizers and manure for her coffee nursery

loans.name: María Dolores

texts.es:
La Señora María forma parte del banco comunal Unión Progresista desde hace 13 años, vive por la parroquia de Santa Ana en Cuenca, lugar de clima frió, se encuentra rodea de mucha vegetación y verdes campos, su gente se dedica a la agricultura y ganadería, aun mantiene la cultura y tradiciones de sus pueblos.

La Señora María tiene 58 años, es casada y ha concebido 11 hijos, cinco de ellos son casados y viven independientes, seis de sus hijos solteros trabajan y le ayudan económicamente, también está a cargo de 2 nietos a quien esta criando. Su esposo presta sus servicios como guardia de seguridad, la casa en la que viven es propia.

Doña María se dedica al cuidado de su hogar, pero para aportar a la economía de su hogar se dedica a la agricultura, lo que cosecha es para el consumo de su hogar y si existe un sobrante lo vende, también se dedica a la crianza de animales como cuyes, gallinas y ganado.

Su nuevo crédito lo va a invertir en la compra cerdos y alimento para sus animales. 

Su meta es tener un criadero de pollos.
texts.en:
María has been part of the Union Progresista community bank for 13 years.  She lives in the parish of Santa Ana in Cuenca, a place with a cold climate that is surrounded by vegetation and green fields.  The people work in farming and raising livestock while maintaining the culture and traditions of their people.

María is 58 years old, married, and has 11 children, five of whom are married and live independently and six are single, work, and help her financially.  She also cares for two of her grandchildren who she is raising.  Her husband works as a security guard and they own the house they live in.

María cares for her home, but she supports the finances of her household with farming.  The crops she plants are for consumption by her household, and if there is extra, it is sold.  She also raises animals such as guinea pigs, chickens, and cattle.

Her new loan is to purchase pigs and animal feed.  Her goal is to have a chicken farm.

loans.use: to purchase pigs and animal feed.

loans.name: Hemdi

texts.en:
Hemdi is a 24 year-old single young man. He lives with some of his colleagues in a small apartment in Sana'a, Yemen. 

Hemdi works as a traffic officer. He decided to learn how to use a computer and its applications in order to improve his skills and look for another job,.  However, he does not have sufficient money to buy a laptop. Therefore, he applied for a loan in the amount of 100,000 YER from Kiva partner AMB.  Hemdi looks forward to starting up his own enterprise.

loans.use: to purchase a laptop for personal use.

loans.name: Alexandra Isabel

texts.es:
La Señora Alexandra está realizando su segundo crédito a lado de sus amigas y compañeras del banco comunal Las Cuencanitas, vive en la ciudad de Cuenca, esta ciudad es desde Diciembre de 1999 Patrimonio Cultural de la Humanidad, tiene un clima frió, una muy variada gastronomía que cautiva el paladar de propio y extraños, su gente es amable, gentil y lo más importante que una mantienen la cultura y tradiciones de sus pueblos.

La Señora Alexandra tiene 29 años, es casada y en su unión conyugal ha concebido un hijo de 10 años que está estudiando en una escuelita de la ciudad. Su esposo es muy hábil y se dedica a la elaboración de artesanías, no tienen casa propia por lo que viven arrendando.

Doña Alexandra al igual que su esposo se dedica a la elaboración de artesanías, realizan figuras, tejidos, manillas y más productos que vende recorriendo por la ciudad. 

Su nuevo crédito lo va a invertir en la compra de cerámica, pinturas, hilos, lana y otra materia prima para continuar agrandando su negocio. 

Su meta es aprender hablar ingles  y tocar instrumentos musicales.
texts.en:
Alexandra is getting her second loan along side her friends and partners in the communal bank "Las Cuencanitas" (The Ladies of Cuenca). She lives in the city of Cuenca, which has been a UNESCO World Heritage site since December 1999. It has a cold climate and a varied gastronomy that captivates the palate of both natives and locals alike. Its people are friendly, kind, and most importantly, they preserve the culture and traditions of their villages.

Alexandra is 29 years old and married, and she and her husband have a ten year old son who is studying in a small school in the city. Her husband is a highly skilled artisan.  They do not have their own home, but rather rent.

Alexandra, like her husband, also works in artisanry. They make figurines, weavings, beaded bracelets, and other goods that they sell while traveling through the city.

She will invest this new loan in the purchase of ceramics, paints, thread, yard, and other raw goods to help keep growing her business. Her goal is to learn to speak English and play musical instruments.

loans.use: purchase ceramics, paints, thread, wool, and more.

loans.name: Saida Patricia

texts.es:
La Señora Saida forma parte del banco comunal Las Cuencanitas desde hace 3 años tiempo en el que ido reafirmando su amistad con sus compañeras, vive en la ciudad de Cuenca, esta ciudad es desde Diciembre de 1999 Patrimonio Cultural de la Humanidad, tiene un clima frió, una muy variada gastronomía que cautiva el paladar de propio y extraños, su gente es amable, gentil y lo más importante que una mantienen la cultura y tradiciones de sus pueblos.

La Señora Saida tiene 39 años, es divorciada pero en su unión conyugal ha concebido un hijo de 19 años que está estudiando en un colegio de la ciudad. No tiene casa propia por lo que vive arrendando. 

Doña Saida es propietaria de un pequeño taller donde confecciona ropa deportiva en este negocio se encuentra desde hace 15 años, es toda  una profesional en esta área ya que ha estudiando, como es su negocio propio labora de domingo a domingo sin un horario fijo.

Su nuevo crédito va a invertir en la compra de telas e hilos. 

Su meta es agrandar su taller y tener operarios.
texts.en:
For the three years, Saida has been part of the communal bank "Las Cuencanitas" (The Ladies of Cuenca) and has continuously built her friendship with her partners. She lives in the city of Cuenca, which has been a UNESCO World Heritage site since December 1999. It has a cold climate and a varied gastronomy that captivates the palate of both natives and locals alike. Its people are friendly, kind, and most importantly, they preserve the culture and traditions of their villages.

Saida is 39 years old. She is divorced, but she has a 19-year-old son from her marriage who is studying in a high school in the city. She rents rather than owning her own home.  Saida is the owner of a small shop where she makes sportswear, a business she has run for fifteen years. She is entirely professional in this field, having studied it, and as it is her own business, she works every single day, Sunday to Sunday, without a set schedule.

Her new credit will be invested in the purchase of fabric and threads. Her goal is to enlarge her shop and hire workers.

loans.use: purchase fabric and thread.

loans.name: Khantati Group

texts.es:
La A.C. “KHANTATI”  iniciará el tercer ciclo en Pro Mujer, como parte del Centro Focal de Patacamaya, está compuesta por diez integrantes y está dirigida por una mesa directiva donde la señora Susana es la Tesorera. Los negocios que las integrantes de la asociación comunal llevan adelante son variados entre ellos existen: producción de leche, producción de papa y chuño, venta de queso, artesanía en tejidos, tienda de barrio.

El crédito que sacaran beneficiara a pequeñas microempresarias donde la señora Susana es integrante, ella indica que hace tres ciclos que integra Pro Mujer, ingresando por invitación de un promotor de la institución que fue a visitarle a su casa. En la actualidad ella tiene un negocio de tejido y venta de guantes y chalinas; da a conocer que este negocio lo aprendió de sus padres y posteriormente decide implementar su propio espacio de negocio.
 
El crédito que ahora sacará es para la renovación de herramientas (compra de lana) que adquirirá de las ferias de la ciudad de El Alto y posteriormente a la elaboración lo comercializará en su espacio de venta. Esta forma de trabajo le permite generar recursos para mantener en lo posible a su hogar pues ella es casada y tiene cuatro hijos.  

Cuando se le consulta qué le gusta de Pro Mujer, ella responde que le gusta el área de salud y el seguro de vida.
texts.en:
The communal bank "Khantati" will start its third cycle with Pro Mujer, as a part of the Patacamaya regional office. It is made up of ten members and is led by a directing board in which Susana is the treasurer. The businesses that the members have vary. Among them are: milk production, potato and freeze-dried potato production, cheese sales, artisan goods with fabric, and a neighborhood store. The loan that they will take out will benefit the group of micro-business owners, of which Susana is a member.

She says that she joined Pro Mujer three cycles ago, joining by invitation of an institution promoter who came to visit her at home. Currently, she has a fabric business and sells gloves and scarves. She says that she learned this business from her parents and later decided to open her own business location. The loan she will get now is to renew tools (buy wool) which she will get from fairs in the city of El Alto. After making them, she will sell them in from her local. 

This work allows her to have resources to support her home as much as possible, since she is married and has four children. When asked what she likes about Pro Mujer, she says that she likes the health services and the life insurance.

loans.use: to buy wool.

loans.name: María Manuela

texts.es:
La Señora María es una socia muy alegre y amable que forma parte del banco comunal Unión Progresista desde hace 5 años, vive por la parroquia de Santa Ana en Cuenca, lugar de clima frió, se encuentra rodea de mucha vegetación y verdes campos, su gente se dedica a la agricultura y ganadería, aun mantiene la cultura y tradiciones de sus pueblos.

Doña María tiene 53 años, es casada y en su unión conyugal ha concebido 7 hijos, cinco de sus hijos son casados y viven independientes, sus dos últimos hijos tienen 12 y 9 años y estudian en el colegio y en la escuela. 

La Señora María se dedica a los quehaceres de su hogar y a la agricultura, lo que cosecha lo vende y también lo utiliza para el consumo de su hogar. Cría y vende gallinas, cerdos, pollos y ganado, también trabaja 3 días a la semana como empleada domestica. 

Su nuevo crédito lo va  a invertir en la compra de pollos y en alimento para sus animales. 

Su meta es crecer más en la crianza de animales.
texts.en:
María is a happy and kind person who has been part of the Union Progresista community bank for five years.  She lives in Santa Ana parish in Cuenca, a place with a cold climate which is surrounded by vegetation and green fields.  The inhabitants work as farmers and raising livestock while maintaing the culture and traditions of their ancestors.  

María is 53 years old, married, and has 7 children, five of whom are married and live independently.  Her other two children are 12 and 9 years old and attend school.  She takes care of her home and works as a farmer.  She sells what she plants and also uses it for household consumption.  She raises and sells chickens, pigs, and cattle, as well as working three days a week as a maid.

She is requesting this loan to purchase chickens and animal feed.  Her goal is to grow more in raising livestock.

loans.use: to purchase chickens and animal feed.

loans.name: Melinda

texts.en:
Melinda is a 29-year-old married woman from Talibon, Bohol. She is the mother of a 2-year-old son. She runs an eatery. She sells homemade meals like stew, vegetables, fried chicken, pork and various soups on the menu. She has been running an eatery for almost one year now.

She requested a loan of 5,000 PHP to buy more ingredients like vegetables, chicken and pork, and also utensils used in cooking. 

In the future, Melinda hopes that she can expand her eatery business to provide her family with nutritious food and save for the education of her child.

loans.use: to buy more ingredients like vegetables, chicken and pork, and also utensils used in cooking.

loans.name: Melchora

texts.en:
This is Melchora, 52, a resident of GMA, Cavite, Philippines. She is married to Johnny and they have children. She and her husband manage their household while operating the business. She works hard to provide income for their everyday expenses. 

Melchora operates the buy-and-sell business of her family. What she basically does is buy general merchandise from wholesalers, and then sell it with a little profit. Her products are men’s and women’s clothes and other products of the like. Customers are attracted to buy due to the low selling prices and the many options she offers. Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community.  She earns a minimum of 300 Philippine Pesos (PHP) in sales every day.

To help her continue operations of her business, she is requesting a PHP 15,000 loan. She will use the loan to buy additional stock of merchandise like men's clothing, women's clothing and kids' clothing needed in her business.

Melchora hopes that her business will get bigger. She dreams to give her children a good life and education. She meets up with her co-fellowship* members every week to share stories of her life and business and to also draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to pay for additional stock of merchandise like men's clothing, women's clothing and kids' clothing needed in her business.

loans.name: Dolores

texts.es:
La Señora Dolores forma parte de banco comunal Las Cuencanitas desde hace 12 años. Vive en la ciudad de Cuenca, esta ciudad es desde Diciembre de 1999 Patrimonio Cultural de la Humanidad, tiene un clima frió, una muy variada gastronomía que cautiva el paladar de propio y extraños, su gente es amable, gentil y lo más importante que una mantienen la cultura y tradiciones de sus pueblos.

La Señora. Dolores tiene 48 años, es separada pero en su unión conyugal ha concebido 3 hijos de 20,19 y 17 años, su primer hijo trabaja y le ayuda económicamente, su segunda ya es casada y vive independiente, su último hijo está estudiando en un colegio de la ciudad. No tiene casa propia por lo que vive arrendando.

Doña Dolores es oriunda de la provincia del Cotopaxi pero desde hace 25 años vino a vivir a Cuenca, en la ciudad se dedica al negocio familiar  que es  la venta ambulante de mote choclo, papas con cuero o sancocho (todas ellas comidas típicas de la localidad).

Su nuevo crédito va a invertir en la compra de víveres para continuar con su negocio. 

Su sueño es que sus hijos sean profesionales.
texts.en:
Dolores has been part of the communal bank "Las Cuencanitas" (The Ladies of Cuenca) for 12 years. She lives in the city of Cuenca, which has been a UNESCO World Heritage site since December 1999. It has a cold climate and a varied gastronomy that captivates the palate of both natives and locals alike. Its people are friendly, kind, and most importantly, they preserve the culture and traditions of their villages.

Dolores is 48 years old. She is separated, but from her marriage she has three children, aged 20, 19 and 17. Her oldest son works and helps her economically. Her second is married and lives independently, and her youngest attends a high school in the city. She does not own her own home, but rather rents.

Dolores is a native of the province of Cotopaxi, but she came to live in Cuenca 25 years ago, and it is here that she began her family business, which is the traveling sales of foods such as puffed corn kernels, potatoes with pork strips, or stew (all typical foods of the region).

Her new credit will be used to invest in the foodstuffs she needs to carry on with her business. Her dream is to see all her children become professionals.

loans.use: purchase ingredients for her traveling food cart.

loans.name: Sabali Group

texts.fr:
Les quatre  membres du groupe Sabali sont constitués essentiellement de femmes mariées avec une moyenne d’âge de 39  ans, et ont en moyenne 4 enfants. Elles vivent la plupart dans des  familles monogamiques à Hamdallaye  un des quartiers populaires de la ville de Sikasso 3ème région administrative du Mali. 
Elles sont à leur troisième prêt avec l’institution de micro finance Soro Yiriwaso afin de satisfaire le besoin de leur clientèle. Les prêts antérieure ont été bien dénoué.
Diara  debout en deuxième position de la gauche vers la droite sur la photo fait la vente de chaussures dans ce groupe de femmes, sa renommée en la matière fait d’elle une vendeuse très sollicitée. 
Elle compte acheter avec son  prêt  50 paires de chaussures. Elle les revend de façon ambulante et en famille au comptant et à crédit à sa clientèle composée d’hommes et de femmes. 
Elle  envisage réaliser un bénéfice mensuel moyen de 25.000FCFA dont une partie est  utilisée  pour payer le prêt et son interêt et l’autre pour son épargne .
Elle ambitionne d’augmenter son chiffre d’affaire pour mieux satisfaire sa clientèle.
texts.en:
Most of the members of the Sabali group are married women, who are, on average, 39 years old and have four children each. Most of them live in monogamous families in Hamdallaye, one of the working-class neighborhoods of the city of Sikasso (third administrative region of Mali).

They are on their third loan with the microfinance institution Soro Yiriwaso with whom they collaborate in order to meet the needs of their customers.  Their previous loans were duly repaid. 
 
Within this group of women, Diara sells shoes.  She is quite well-known in her field and is a very popular seller.  In the photo, she is the woman standing second from the left.

She plans to use her loan to buy 50 pairs of shoes. She resells her merchandise as an itinerant seller and with her family, for cash or on credit, to both men and women.

She is hoping to make an average monthly profit of 25,000 CFA francs, part of which will be used to repay her loan and the interest, while the rest will be saved.  Her ambition is to increase her turnover in order to better satisfy the needs of her customers.

loans.use: to buy shoes.

loans.name: Danny

texts.en:
Danny is a 34-year-old married man with an only child. He lives in Dela Paz, Clarin, Misamis Occidental. He operates a general store, selling goods for a living in the local community to support the income of his working wife. He has been in this business for five years. 

In order to purchase additional goods like canned goods, rice and corn grits for sale, he requests an amount of 5,000 PHP from GDMPC Microcredit, where he had joined recently. 

In the future, he wants to expand his business to generate more income for the family.

loans.use: to purchase additional goods like canned goods, rice and corn grits for sale.

loans.name: Leslie

texts.en:
Leslie is married with two children. He is 26 years old and lives in Liposong, Ozamis City. He operates a service-based business, providing transportation services to earn a living. Recently, he has requested a loan of 6,000 PHP from GDMPC to purchase a new set of tires. 

In the future, Leslie hopes for his children to finish their studies, and he hopes to double his income from his business.

loans.use: to purchase a new set of tires.

loans.name: Enriqueta

texts.en:
This is Enriqueta, 59, a resident of GMA, Cavite, Philippines. Her partner is Nanceso, who works as a driver, and they have children. She and her partner manage their household while operating the business. She is working hard to continually provide income for their everyday expenses.

Enriqueta operates a variety store. In the Philippines, a variety store is a retail store that sells inexpensive items, often with a single price for all items in the store. It is the place to go to buy one sachet of shampoo, a PHP 5-worth of cooking oil, or an egg. She earns by getting supplies at wholesale prices and selling by the piece. Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community. She earns a minimum of PHP 500 in sales every day.

She is requesting a PHP 22,000 loan to help her continue in the operation of her business. She will use the loan to buy groceries, toiletries and beverages to expand her product inventory.

Enriqueta dreams to expand her business and hopes to have a vacation. She meets up with her co-fellowship* members every week to share stories of her life and business and to also draw strength and inspiration from the fellowship and the Word of God she studies.

*All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to pay for grocery items, toiletries and beverages needed in her business.

loans.name: Dorcy

texts.en:
This is Dorcy. Her previous loan helped her a lot in her business, for she was able to buy all the needed materials. The loan also helped in their household expenditures. She and her husband continue to work to provide for their everyday needs. 

She would like to apply for another loan, this time for 19,000 PHP, to buy additional supplies of raw materials like fabric, thread and needles needed in her business. Her profits from the business will definitely help her to sustain their daily needs. She looks forward to this financial increase with gladness and thankfulness in her heart.

Dorcy hopes her business grows and dreams that her family is always in good condition. She meets up with her co-fellowship* members every week to share stories of her life and business and to draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to pay for fabric, thread and other materials needed in her business.

loans.name: Jérusalem Group

texts.fr: La cliente Kavira est présidente  du groupe de crédit « Jérusalem », doyenne,  entrepreneur courageuse, âgée de 51 ans et mère de 6 enfants dont 4 ayant leurs propres foyers et 2 étudiants. Son conjoint est un chauffeur. La cliente est vendeuse de pagnes (habits). Elle commença cette activité avec le fonds reçu de son mari. Ce nouveau prêt va lui servir d’acheter 25 pièces de pagnes. La crise financière, l’insécurité sont des obstacles majeurs pour le développement de son activité. Dans le futur, elle souhaite agrandir son entreprise, scolariser ses enfants. Ainsi, elle remercie Hekima pour son soutien en micro crédit aux femmes entrepreneurs.
texts.en:
This client, Kavira, is the president of the loan group "Jérusalem". She is the most senior member, a brave entrepreneur, 51 years old, and a mother of six children, of whom four have their own homes, and two are students. Her husband is a driver. This client sells 'pagnes' (the colorful cloth of western Africa). She started this business with funds from her husband. 

This new loan will be used to purchase 25 lengths of 'pagne' cloth. The financial crisis and insecurity are some of the main obstacles in developing her business. For the future, she would like to expand her enterprise and provide schooling for her children. So, she thanks Hekima for its microcredit support of women entrepreneurs.

loans.use: to purchase 'pagne' cloth to sell

location.country: The Democratic Republic of the Congo

loans.name: María Carmen

texts.es:
La Señora. María forma parte del banco comunal Unión Progresista desde hace 8 años, vive por la parroquia de Santa Ana en Cuenca, lugar de clima frió, se encuentra rodea de mucha vegetación y verdes campos, su gente se dedica a la agricultura y ganadería, aun mantiene la cultura y tradiciones de sus pueblos.

La Señora. María tiene 54 años y es madre soltera de 8 hijos, cuatro de ellos ya son casados y viven independientes, tres de sus hijos solteros trabajan y le ayudan  económicamente, su último hijo está estudiando en un colegio de la localidad. La casa en la que vive es propia.

Doña María se dedica a las tareas que aprendió de sus padres la cual es la crianza de animales como cerdos, pollos, gallinas de postura, cuyes y ganado, también siembra y lo que cosecha vende y utiliza para su consumo. 

El dinero de su crédito va a invertir en la comprar de ganado. 

Su meta es tener ganado de mejor calidad.
texts.en:
María has been part of the Unión Progresista communal bank for 8 years. She lives in the Parish of Santa Ana in Cuenca, an area with a cold climate surrounded by a lot of vegetation and green fields. The people of this area work in agriculture and livestock farming, maintaining the culture and traditions of their peoples. 

Maria is 54 years old and the single mother of 8 children, four of whom are already married and live independently. Three of her single children work and help her financially and her last child is studying at college in the area. She lives in her own house. 

María works in the job she learned from her parents, which is raising animals like pigs, chickens, laying hens, guinea pigs and cattle. She also grows crops and she consumes and sells what she harvests. 

She is going to invest the money from the loan into buying livestock. Her goal is to have better quality livestock.

loans.use: to buy livestock.

loans.name: Family  (Cuenca) Group

texts.es:
El grupo de crédito Family está formado por 7 socias y 1 socio, quienes laboran en diferentes actividades las mismas que les dan la oportunidad de mejorar su estabilidad económica y sacar adelante a sus familias, son personas muy trabajadoras, amables y gentiles que mantienen siempre su buen humor y su cultura y tradiciones inculcadas por sus padres. Viven en la ciudad de Cuenca que está rodeada 4 ríos y grandes montañas, tiene un clima frió, su centro es una mezcla de la arquitectura colonial y moderna. 

Una de las socias de este grupo es la Señora. Ana, tiene 35 años, es casada  y aun no ha concebido hijos. Su esposo labora como albañil, no tienen casa propia por lo que viven arrendando. 

Doña Ana se dedica a la venta de verduras y frutas, trabajo en el cual lleva 10 años, labora de lunes a sábados sin un horario fijo y tiene su propio puesto en un mercado de la ciudad.  

Su nuevo crédito  lo va a invertir en la compra de verduras y frutas para continuar creciendo en su negocio. 

Su sueño es tener su casa propia.

La foto pequeña es de una socia que no pudo estar presente cuando se tomo la foto del grupo.
texts.en:
The credit group Family is made up of eight members: one man and seven women. They work different jobs, but each one gives them the opportunity to improve their financial stability and ensure that their families get ahead. They are very hard working and kind people, who are always keep their sense of humor and the culture and traditions passed down to them by their parents. They live in the city of Cuenca, which is surrounded by rivers and mountains. It has a cold climate, and downtown Cuenca is a mix of modern and colonial architecture. 

Ana is one of the members of this group. She is married, 35 years old, and has no children. Her husband works as a bricklayer. They do not have their own home; they rent. 

Ana works selling fruits and vegetables, which she has done going on 10 years. She works Monday through Saturday, with no fixed schedule. She has her own stand in a market in the city. Her new loan will be used to purchase fruits and vegetables so she can continue to grow her business.

Her dream is to one day have her own home. 

In the group photo, the small picture at the bottom is of a member who could not be present when the group photo was taken.

loans.use: to purchase fruits and vegetables.

loans.name: Valeriana

texts.en:
This is Valeriana, 39, a resident of GMA, Cavite, Philippines. She is married to Allan, her business partner, and is a mother to her children. She, together with her husband, manages her own household while operating the business. At this time, she is working hard to continually provide income for their everyday expenses.

Valeriana is a dried fish vendor. She buys different kinds of dried fish from her suppliers, then sells it in the market. Her store is located in a temporary fish market. Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community. She earns a minimum of 1,000 PHP (Philippines pesos) in sales every day.

To help her continue operations of her business, she is requesting a 20,000 PHP loan. She will be utilizing the loan to buy more dried fish needed in her business. She expects a boost in her business income as she expands her business.  

Valeriana dreams to expand her business and have her own stall in the market. She meets up with her co-fellowship members to share stories of her work every week, and this is where she can also draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay microfinance loans.

loans.use: To pay for more dried fish needed in her business.

loans.name: Rosa Maria

texts.es:
Rosa es una mujer de 40 años, nació en Pujilí tiene aprobada la instrucción primaria y desde muy joven convive con su pareja Luis desde hace algunos años con quien tiene 3 hijos de 21, 20 y 12 años, estudiantes a quienes aspiran verlos convertidos en profesionales de excelencia. Juntos viven actualmente en Latacunga, la capital de la provincia de Cotopaxi, una de las provincias que forma parte de la Región Sierra del Ecuador. En los últimos años Latacunga se ha desarrollado notablemente de tal forma que es considerada una de las más importantes de la región gracias a la industria florícola, minera, metalúrgica, agroindustria, agrícola y ganadera. Además existen establecimientos de negocios que generan interesantes ingresos lo que le convierte en una ciudad comercial y con varias oportunidades para salir adelante. En esta ciudad muchas de las fiestas conservan un profundo arraigo y pureza muy cercanos a los orígenes históricos o de la tradición ancestral.
Rosa al ver la necesidad económica en su hogar, decidió desde hace un año, aportar con los gastos del hogar, dando el paso de emprender en un negocio de comercialización de frutas y verduras, ubicado en un lugar estratégico de la ciudad en donde la mayoría de sus clientes son amas de casa. Rosa permanece en el local que es rentado atendiendo la demanda de sus clientes durante 10 horas cada día, con la esperanza de que todos sus productos se vendan, pues al ser productos perecibles, se deterioran al poco tiempo y no es conveniente arriesgarse a perder sus clientes por no vender productos frescos, lo cual en el caso de ventas bajas significa una pérdida. Desde el establecimiento de su negocio, Rosa ha intentado adquirir un préstamo en varias instituciones financieras, lo cual no ha sido posible por no cumplir con todos los requisitos que allí le piden y además porque lleva poco tiempo con su negocio. Ahora solicita un préstamo para comprar frutas de temporada al por mayor como por ejemplo mandarina, naranja, limón, pera, melón, sandía  y uva. Ella pretende surtir su negocio de tal forma que sus clientes aumenten y así mejoren sus ingresos lo que permitirá tener a su familia un mejor estilo de vida. Rosa agradece a todos los inversionistas de Kiva quienes a través de Fundación Alternativa aportan para que crezca en su negocio y pueda administrar su microempresa con éxito.
texts.en:
Rosa is a 40-year-old woman who was born in Pujilí. She completed elementary school and has lived with her partner Luis since she was very young. They have lived together for many years and have three children who are 21, 20 and 12 years old, presently students, who they hope to see become excellent professionals. They currently live together in Latacunga, the capital of Cotopaxi province, one of the provinces that make up part of Ecuador's mountainous region. In recent years Latacunga has developed markedly in such a way that it is considered one of the most important towns of the region due to its industries, such as flower growing, mining, metallurgy, agroindustry, farming and livestock raising. In addition, there are business establishments that produce significant revenue which makes it a commercial city with many opportunities to get ahead. In this city many of the festivals maintain deep roots and a purity that is very close to the historical origins and the ancestral tradition.

Rosa could see the economic need in her household so one year ago she decided to contribute to the costs of the home, taking the step of beginning a business selling fruit and vegetables. It is located in a strategic part of the city where the majority of her clients are housewives. Rosa is present in the rented premises filling the requests of her customers for 10 hours a day, with the hope that all her products will sell, since being perishable products they will deteriorate in a short time. It is not a good idea to take the chance of losing her customers by not selling fresh products, so if her sales are low she sustains a loss. From the time her business was established, Rosa has been trying to obtain a loan from various financial institutions but this has not been possible because she cannot fill all their requirements and because her business has only been open for a short time. Presently she is seeking a loan to buy seasonal fruits wholesale, for example, mandarins, oranges, lemons, pears, melons, watermelons and grapes. She is trying to stock her store so that her customers increase and in this way her income increases. This will enable her family to have a higher standard of living. 

Rosa thanks all the Kiva investors that contribute through Fundación Alternativa [Alternative Foundation] so that she can grow her business and manage her small business successfully.

loans.use: to buy seasonal fruits

loans.name: Alejo

texts.en: Alejo is married with five children. Alejo is 57 years old and lives in Gata Diot, Clarin. He operates a service-based business, providing transportation services to local community members to earn a living. He has been doing this for seven years. He has requested a new loan of 5,000 PHP (Philippines pesos) to purchase tires for his vehicle. In the future, Alejo hopes to purchase additional motorcycles for his business.

loans.use: to purchase tires for his vehicle.

loans.name: Entrada A Chunazana  (Nabón) Group

texts.es:
El banco comunal Entrada a Chunazana está formado por 7 mujeres quienes trabajan especialmente en las tareas del campo, las cuales aprendieron de sus padres y tienen la oportunidad de aportar a la economía de sus hogares y a su vez pasar tiempo con sus hijos, son mujeres que aun mantienen su cultura y tradiciones. Viven en el cantón Nabon, este  lugar es de clima frió y está rodeado de exuberante vegetación, son personas de un corazón cálido y aun mantienen su gastronomía típica.

Una de las socias de este grupo es la Señora. Digna, tiene 25 años, es casada y fruto de su unión conyugal ha concebido 2 hijos de 4 y 2 años, su primer hijo está estudiando en una escuelita de la localidad. Su esposo labora como jornalero, no tienen casa propia por lo que vive en casa de sus suegros con quienes comparte los gastos del hogar.

Doña Digna se dedica a la agricultura y lo que cosecha es para el consumo de su casa, también cría y vende cuyes, gallinas y ganado del cual vende la leche. 

El dinero de su crédito lo va a invertir en la compra de alimento para sus animales y en semillas. 

Su sueño es tener su casa propia.
texts.en:
The communal bank Entrada a Chunazana consists of seven women who work primarily with farming activities which they have learnt from their parents, and with the help of which they can contribute to the economy of their households while spending time with their children. These women maintain their culture and traditions. They live in the Nabón Canton, a place with a cold climate, surrounded by lush vegetation, they are people with warm hearts who still maintain their typical food culture.

One of the members of this group is Digna, 25, who is married and has two children from this marriage aged four and two. Her first child goes to a small school in the locality. Her husband works as day laborer, they don't own a house of their own so they live with her parents-in-law and share the expenses of the household with them. 

Digna works in agriculture, her crops is for the family's own consumption. She also raises cavies, chickens, and cattle whose milk she sells. She will use the loan to buy animal feed and seeds. Her dream is to own a house.

loans.use: to buy animal feed and seeds

loans.name: Adelaida

texts.en:
This is Adelaida, 54, a resident of GMA, Cavite, Philippines. She is a widow and a mother to her children. She manages the household while operating the business. At this time, she is working hard to continually provide income for her everyday expenses.

Adelaida operates a rug-making business. She mainly offers rugs, including those round palm-sized ones and the much larger doormats and other crafts that most rug-makers come up with every day. As rugs are a major part of Filipino housekeeping and cleaning, rugs are one of the most common products that can be bought, sometimes even from a peddler while you are riding in a speeding jeepney down the highway. Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community. She earns a minimum of 500 PHP (Philippines pesos) in sales every day.

To help her continue operations of her business, she is requesting a 30,000 PHP loan. She will be utilizing the loan to buy more quantities of raw materials like fabric, thread and other materials for her business. 

Adelaida dreams for a continuous success in her business and hopes to have more customers. She meets up with her co-fellowship members to share stories of her life and business every week, and this is where she can also draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay microfinance loans.

loans.use: To pay for fabric, cloth, thread and other materials needed in her business.

loans.name: Ernesto

texts.es: Ernesto tiene la edad de 67 años, está soltero. El crédito lo quiere para la compra de ganado de cría y cuando estén grandes venderlos y obtener una ganancia. El negocio del ganado le ayudará a el  a salir adelante. Es la primera vez que Ernesto se financia con FUDECOSUR, el manifiesta que el comité de crédito le ha ayudado mucho y le ha brindaron muchas facilidades. El espera que con este proyecto crezca y logre sus objetivos y así pueda en un futuro tener  una mejor calidad de vida y una mejor estabilidad económica. Es el primer  préstamo que  recibido de FUDECOSUR. El no había tenido antes otros préstamos en bancos estatales, pero FUDECOSUR le ha brindado el préstamo con mayores facilidades y la tasa de intereses mucho más baja.
texts.en:
Ernesto is 67 years old and single. He is applying for this loan in order to buy young cattle which he will sell when they are full-grown to make a profit. The livestock business helps him to make a living. 

This is the first time Ernesto takes a loan from FUDECOSUR, he states that the institution has helped him a lot and has provided him with many facilities. He hopes that this project will make him grow and achieve his goals so that he can have a better quality of life and more economic stability in the future. This is the first loan that he has received from FUDECOSUR. He has not received any previous loans from state banks, but FUDECOSUR has offered him a loan with more facility and much lower interest rate.

loans.use: to buy cattle

loans.name: Florencio

texts.en:
Florencio lives in Aurora, Zamboanga del Sur. He is 44 years old, married and has three children. For a living, he operates a service-based business providing motor transportation services. He has been doing this for years. 

In 2007, he joined GDMPC microcredit and gained access to microfinance services. He is now requesting an amount of 25,000 PHP (Philippines pesos) to finance the license renewal and buy motor accessories so he can provide a better and more comfortable service. In the near future, he wants to procure another vehicle to be used for a business expansion.

loans.use: to finance the license renewal and buy motor accessories.

loans.name: Zenaida

texts.en:
Zenaida is 49 years of age, married and has six children. Three of her children are already married, two are still studying and the other has graduated.

Zenaida grows rice crops in her local community. She aims to keep her rice field productive and profitable every cropping season but because she struggles for lack of capital, she is now requesting the financial assistance of KIVA lenders. She would like to borrow PHP 20,000 to buy seedlings, fertilizer and insecticides to ensure good production of her rice field. Zenaida is looking forward to the approval of her requested loan so she could further improve her business and secure the future of her family and especially the education of her children.

loans.use: to buy seedlings, fertilizer and insecticides for her rice farming business

loans.name: Analiza

texts.en:
Analiza is 51 years old, married with four children and lives in Segatic Daku, Misamis Occidental, Philippines. 

Analiza owns farmland and operates a farm, harvesting and planting corn to sell. Aside from corn farming, she also planted bananas on her farm in order to gain additional income for the family. She has been in this business for several years .

In 2011, Analiza joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. 

Analiza is requesting a loan of 30,000 PHP to purchase fertilizer and additional seedlings for replanting. She plans to use the additional revenue generated with this loan to expand her farm.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizer and additional seedlings for replanting

loans.name: Honey Fe

texts.en:
This is Honey Fe, 27, a resident of Tanza, Cavite, Philippines. She is married to Eleno, her business partner, and is mother to her four children. She, together with her husband, manages their household while operating the business. At this time, she is working hard to continually provide income for their everyday expenses.

Honey Fe is a fish vendor. She buys different kinds of fish at wholesale prices and sells them by the kilo. She buys fish at the local fish port early in the morning. There are many patrons who prefer her products since they are assured of freshness and cleanliness. Her store is located in a temporary fish market. Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community. She earns a minimum of 1,000 PHP (Philippines pesos) in sales every day.

To help her continue operations of her business, she is requesting a 15,000 PHP loan. She will be utilizing the loan to buy more fish to be sold every day. She expects a boost in her business income as she expands her business.  

Honey Fe hopes to expand her business and dreams to give her children a good and quality education. She meets up with her co-fellowship members to share stories of her work every week, and this is where she can also draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay microfinance loans.

loans.use: To pay for more fish needed in her business.

loans.name: Bitinia

texts.es: Bitinia tiene la edad de 25 años, es casada y tiene cuatro hijos. Ella el crédito lo quiere para la compra de ganado de engorde y cuando estén grandes venderlos y obtener una ganancia. El negocio del ganado le ayudará a ella y a su familia a salir adelante. Ella espera que con este proyecto crezca y logre sus objetivos y así pueda en un futuro brindarle a su familia una mejor calidad de vida y una mejor estabilidad económica. Es el primer  préstamo que  recibido de FUDECOSUR. Ella no había tenido antes otros préstamos en bancos estatales, pero FUDECOSUR le ha brindado el préstamo con mayores facilidades y la tasa de intereses mucho más baja.
texts.en:
Bitinia, 25, is married and has 4 children. She wants a loan to buy cattle that she will fatten and then sell for a profit. The cattle business will help her and her family to get ahead. She hopes that with the project she can grow and achieve her objectives so that in the future she will be able to give her family a better quality of life and greater financial stability. 

This is her first loan with FUDECOSUR. She hasn't had other loans from state banks, but FUDECOSUR has given her a loan more easily and with a a much lower interest rate.

loans.use: to buy cattle.

loans.name: Eloisa

texts.en: Eloisa is a 44-year-old married entrepreneur with four children from Sebac, Tudela. She has operated a motor transport service business for more than four years. To improve her business, she is borrowing 10,000 PHP from GDMPC microcredit, which she just joined last year to buy accessories like raincoats and tires. Before long, she hopes to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy accessories like raincoats and tires

loans.name: Renato

texts.en:
Renato is 50 years old and married with six children. He lives in Clarin, Misamis, Occidental. He owns and operates a motorcycle transport business in the local community to earn a living. He also manages his farm, planting and harvesting bananas for sale in order to generate additional income. 

He has been with GDMPC since 2011 and is now requesting a loan of 20,000 PHP to purchase fertilizer, such as manure. He dreams to help his children fulfill their ambition to complete their education.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizer, such as manure

loans.name: Nancy

texts.en:
